sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Peter the Chanter, Libellus de contrarietatibus Sacrae Scripturae. William de Montibus, Speculum poenitentis. Pictor in carmine. Miscellaneous Exegetical Tracts
Petrus Cantor. W. de Montibus. Pictor in Carmine
msDesc.p: Vellum, 253 180 , 10.1 x 7, ff. 374, double and single columns, in many hands of cent. xiii, mostly small and pointed.

From Worcester; inside the cover is written (f. 1v):
Liber monasterii Wygornie.

Old binding, velvet (brown-green) over boards: two clasps. Label under horn on front cover: Tractatus de contrarietatibus Scripture cum aliis opusculis plurimis (xvi). This binding is uniform with that of MS 87 and of Trin. Coll. B. 4. 24.
ff. 1-31 + 32a + 32-37 + 37a + 38-64 + 65a + 65-364. Partially imaged: front cover exterior and interior + ff. 1r-21r + 25r + 209r + back cover exterior and interior.

msContents.textLang: Latin with occasional Anglo-Norman words in item 15.
msContents.label: Contents

msItem.head: Peter the Chanter, Libellus de contrarietatibus Sacrae Scripturae

head.title: Tractatus [Petri Cantoris] de contrarietatibus scripturae

msItem.incipit: Uidemus nunc per speculum et in enigmate

msItem.head: Bede the Venerable, De schematibus et tropis

head.title: Liber Cassiodori de figuris vel modis locutionum, quae a grammaticis scemata et tropi dicuntur, missus ad Gubertum diaconum

ab.quote: Opus spurium, Bedae ut vult Cavesius potius attribuendum

msItem.ab: (Beda de schematibus: Keil, Gramm. Lat. VII 200)
msItem.incipit: Solet aliquotiens in scripturis ordo uerborum
Quoniam series que in arte gramatica corrigende sunt
msItem.ab: (Extracts)
f. 12v blank

head.title: Expositions on parts of the Old and New Testament
Expositiones in diversos locos veteris et novi testamenti

msItem.incipit: In principio creauit ... ergo in principio creatum fuit celum
msItem.ab: A series of expository paragraphs: no order is observable
f. 20v blank

head.title: Sermons and lectures
Sermones seu lectiones habitae ad scholares quosdam theologicos

msItem.incipit: Egredimini filie syon et uidete ... Ad uos scolares maxime theologos sermo iste dirigitur
Quicumque ad sacre scripture paginam erudiendus
Facies mihi tentorium
msItem.ab: f. 24v blank

head.title: Exposition on the Psalms
Expositio in psalmos

ab.layout: Double columns of 52 lines: to some extent in tabular form

msItem.incipit: Beatus uir
msItem.ab: (handsome initial)
msItem.incipit: In hac serie potest distingui septiformis gratia spiritus
msItem.ab: Ends
msItem.explicit: carnis curam in desideriis ne feceritis

head.title: Sermons and expositions on the Old and New Testament
Plurimi sermones seu expositiones in vetus et novum testamentum

msItem.ab: Begins with 42 lines to a page: at f. 115r the hand changes (after a gap) and there are 60 (and more) lines to a page
msItem.incipit: Post regulas fidei euangelico dogmate promulgatas
msItem.ab: The second hand seems to begin imperfectly at f. 115r. The first beginning of a sermon, on f. 115r, is
msItem.incipit: Ecce ego sternam per ordinem lapides tuos
msItem.ab: Up to f. 118v the writing is rather irregular
A late title Sermo de trinitate bonus
msItem.incipit: Uerbo domini celi firmati sunt
msItem.ab: Only the last three sermons have titles
msItem.incipit: Omnia tempus habent
msItem.ab: Ending

msItem.head: William de Montibus, Speculum poenitentis

head.title: Speculum penitentis editum a magistro Willelmo de Montibus cancellario Lincoln.

msItem.incipit: De peccatorum agnitione tractatum teximus perutilem
msItem.ab: (Will. de Montibus)

head.title: Sermons
Alii sermones

msItem.incipit: Transi hospes orna mensam
msItem.ab: Three Sermons in this hand
Change of hand: at f. 155r begin double columns of 56 lines
msItem.incipit: In tribus commendabilis est beata maria
msItem.ab: At f. 163r single lines again, 64 to a page
msItem.incipit: Secundo Machab. liij. Machabeus suos armauit non clipei et haste munitione
msItem.ab: These are notes for use in sermons
A tract of explanation of Greek words
msItem.incipit: Episcopus dicitur ab epy quod est supra et scopes quod est intendens uel solitudo uel casa uel inspectio
msItem.explicit: elisei campi apud inferos ubi anime piorum requiescunt
msItem.ab: f. 168r - f. 168v blank

msItem.head: William de Montibus, Tropi

head.title: Tropi magistri Willelmi [de Montibus] cancellarii Lincoln. ad theologicam facultatem collecti

msItem.incipit: Dei dona dispensamus pulsantibus claues hostiorum porrigimus

msItem.head: William de Montibus, Numerale

head.title: Numerale
head.name: Gul. de Montibus

head.title: Summa theologiae

msItem.incipit: Introducendis in facultatem theologicam quedam compendiose prelibantur
msItem.explicit: in aliis opusculis nostris copiosius sunt exarata

msItem.head: Geoffrey de Vinsauf, Tria sunt (Documentum de arte versificandi)

head.title: Documenta Galfridi Vinest-sauf de modo et arte dictandi et versificandi

msItem.incipit: Tria sunt circa que cuiuslibet operis uersatur artificium
msItem.explicit: Rideat et pulset lasciua decentius etas
msItem.rubric: Explicit documenta magistri Galfridi le Vin est sauf
msItem.ab: f. 218v blank

head.title: Pictor in carmine
Versus picturis in ecclesiis locandis adaptati

ab.quote: In prologo autor graviter invehit in presumtionem nefandam pictorum, qui ecclesias monstris et chimeris impleverunt, et dicit se hos versus scripsisse ad moderandam eorum licentiam et informandam ignorantiam

msItem.ab: The tract called Pictor in Carmine, of which perhaps the best copy is MS 300 in this library
The present copy has the prologue
msItem.incipit: Dolens in sanctuario dei
msItem.ab: Printed by Delisle, Mélanges de paléographie, p. 206, from a Phillipps MS. Then follows the list of subjects with marginal references
Then the text
msItem.incipit: Femina tritura capud anguis et hunc domitura
msItem.ab: With marginal notes: the text ends abruptly (on the Baptism)
msItem.explicit: Sic aqua baptiste dedit obsequium tibi christe
msItem.ab: f. 226r - f. 226v blank

msItem.head: Petrus Riga, Aurora. Matthew of Vend√¥me, In Tobiam paraphrasis metrica

head.title: Petri de Riga Aurora

ab.quote: Desunt libri Hester, Judith, Job, Cantica Canticorum, historia evangelica et Actus apostolorum

msItem.incipit: Sodalium meorum petitio
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber magistri Petri cuius titulus est aurora
msItem.incipit: Prima facta die duo celum terra leguntur
msItem.ab: The contents are: Genesis - 4 Regum, lib. Machabeorum, lib. Josephi
(Symone quod debet morti soluente, Johannes)
This ends
msItem.incipit: Ecce petis liber, recipis pater alme timorem
msItem.explicit: Pacificum reddit. es filius ec(c)e uocandus
msItem.rubric: Explicit liber magistri Petri qui dicitur aurora
msItem.ab: The Thobias of Math. Vindocinensis follows
msItem.incipit: Ecclesie turonensis apex ouium speculator
Ex agro ueteri uirtutum semina. morum
msItem.ab: Ends
f. 269v blank

head.title: Tract on the Holy Scripture
Tractatus theologicus de difficultatibus S. Scripturae

msItem.incipit: Difficile quod durum quod graue quod asperum
msItem.ab: Treats of the books from Genesis to 2 Chron. ending with a notice of Daniel
msItem.explicit: in mediam ducens secum danielem prophetam remeauit
msItem.ab: and a list of the kings
Cf. MS 30. 1. Andreas Victorinus

msItem.head: Alexander Nequam OSA, Corrogationes Promethei
Alexandri Neckam. Corrogationes Promethei

head.title: Tractatus de arte theologica, in quo primum traduntur regulae interpretationis, et postea applicantur ad diversos locos singulorum librorum S. Scripturae

msItem.incipit: Ferrum situ rubiginem ducit
msItem.ab: The hand changes after a few leaves
Ends
See P. Meyer, Notices et Extraits XXXV 2 (1897)
